member.name: T:Carto.Ui.MapView
member.summary: MapView is an Android-specific view class supporting map rendering and interaction.
MapView is a platform-specific map class supporting map rendering and interaction.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.RegisterLicense(System.String,Android.Content.Context)
member.summary: Registers the SDK license. This class method and must be called before creating any actual MapView instances.
member.param: The license string provided for this application.
Application context for the license.
member.returns: True if license is valid, false if not.

member.summary: Constructs a new MapView object from a context object.
member.param: The context object.

member.summary: Constructs a new MapView object from a context object and attributes.
member.param: The context object.
The attributes.

member.name: F:Carto.Ui.MapView._baseMapView
member.summary: Internal native map view object. Not part of the public API.

member.name: P:Carto.Ui.MapView.MapEventListener
member.summary: The map event listener property. May be null.

member.name: P:Carto.Ui.MapView.Layers
member.summary: The Layers property, that can be used for adding and removing map layers.

member.name: P:Carto.Ui.MapView.Options
member.summary: The Options property, that can be used for modifying various map options.

member.name: P:Carto.Ui.MapView.MapRenderer
member.summary: The MapView property, that can be used for controlling rendering options.

member.name: P:Carto.Ui.MapView.FocusPos
member.summary: The position that the camera is currently looking at.

member.name: P:Carto.Ui.MapView.MapRotation
member.summary: The map rotation in degrees. 0 means looking north, 90 means west, -90 means east and 180 means south.

member.name: P:Carto.Ui.MapView.Tilt
member.summary: The map tilt angle property in degrees. 0 means looking directly at the horizon, 90 means looking directly down.

member.name: P:Carto.Ui.MapView.Zoom
member.summary: The map zoom level property. The value returned is never negative, 0 means absolutely zoomed out and all other values describe some level of zoom.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.Pan(Carto.Core.MapVec,System.Single)
member.summary:
Pans the view relative to the current focus position. The deltaPos vector is expected to be in the coordinate system of the base projection. The new calculated focus position will be clamped to the world bounds and to the bounds set by Options::setPanBounds.
If durationSeconds > 0 the panning operation will be animated over time. If the previous panning animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The coordinate difference the map should be moved by.
The duration in which the tilting operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.SetFocusPos(Carto.Core.MapPos,System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the new absolute focus position. The new focus position is expected to be in the coordinate system of the base projection. The new focus position will be clamped to the world bounds and to the bounds set by Options::setPanBounds.
If durationSeconds > 0 the panning operation will be animated over time. If the previous panning animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The new focus point position in base coordinate system.
The duration in which the tilting operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.Rotate(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Rotates the view relative to the current rotation value. Positive values rotate clockwise, negative values counterclockwise. The new calculated rotation value will be wrapped to the range of (-180 .. 180]. Rotations are ignored if Options::setRotatable is set to false.
If durationSeconds > 0 the rotating operation will be animated over time. If the previous rotating animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The delta angle value in degrees.
The duration in which the zooming operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.Rotate(System.Single,Carto.Core.MapPos,System.Single)
member.summary:
Rotates the view relative to the current rotation value. Positive values rotate clockwise, negative values counterclockwise. The new calculated rotation value will be wrapped to the range of (-180 .. 180]. Rotations are ignored if Options::setRotatable is set to false.
Rotating is done around the specified target position, keeping it at the same location on the screen.
If durationSeconds > 0 the rotating operation will be animated over time. If the previous rotating animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The delta angle value in degrees.
The zooming target position in the coordinate system of the base projection.
The duration in which the zooming operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.SetMapRotation(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the new absolute rotation value. 0 means look north, 90 means west, -90 means east and 180 means south. The rotation value will be wrapped to the range of (-180 .. 180]. Rotations are ignored if Options::setRotatable is set to false.
If durationSeconds > 0 the rotating operation will be animated over time. If the previous rotating animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The new absolute rotation angle value in degrees.
The duration in which the zooming operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.SetMapRotation(System.Single,Carto.Core.MapPos,System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the new absolute rotation value. 0 means look north, 90 means west, -90 means east and 180 means south. The rotation value will be wrapped to the range of (-180 .. 180]. Rotations are ignored if Options::setRotatable is set to false.
Rotating is done around the specified target position, keeping it at the same location on the screen.
If durationSeconds > 0 the rotating operation will be animated over time. If the previous rotating animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The new absolute rotation angle value in degrees.
The zooming target position in the coordinate system of the base projection.
The duration in which the zooming operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.SetRelativeTilt(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Tilts the view relative to the current tilt value. Positive values tilt the view down towards the map, negative values tilt the view up towards the horizon. The new calculated tilt value will be clamped to the range of [30 .. 90] and to the range set by Options::setZoomRange.
If durationSeconds > 0 the tilting operation will be animated over time. If the previous tilting animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The number of degrees the camera should be tilted by.
The duration in which the tilting operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.SetTilt(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the new absolute tilt value. 0 means look directly at the horizon, 90 means look directly down. The minimum tilt angle is 30 degrees and the maximum is 90 degrees. The tilt value can be further constrained by the Options::setTiltRange method. Values exceeding these ranges will be clamped.
If durationSeconds > 0 the tilting operation will be animated over time. If the previous tilting animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The new absolute tilt value in degrees.
The duration in which the tilting operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.SetRelativeZoom(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Zooms the view relative to the current zoom value. Positive values zoom in, negative values zoom out. The new calculated zoom value will be clamped to the range of [0 .. 24] and to the range set by Options::setZoomRange.
If durationSeconds > 0 the zooming operation will be animated over time. If the previous zooming animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The delta zoom value.
The duration in which the zooming operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.SetRelativeZoom(System.Single,Carto.Core.MapPos,System.Single)
member.summary:
Zooms the view relative to the current zoom value. Positive values zoom in, negative values zoom out. The new calculated zoom value will be clamped to the range of [0 .. 24] and to the range set by Options::setZoomRange.
Zooming is done towards the specified target position, keeping it at the same location on the screen.
If durationSeconds > 0 the zooming operation will be animated over time. If the previous zooming animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The delta zoom value.
The zooming target position in the coordinate system of the base projection.
The duration in which the zooming operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.SetZoom(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the new absolute zoom value. The minimum zoom value is 0, which means absolutely zoomed out and the maximum zoom value is 24. The zoom value can be further constrained by the Options::setZoomRange method. Values exceeding these ranges will be clamped.
If durationSeconds > 0 the zooming operation will be animated over time. If the previous zooming animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The new absolute zoom value.
The duration in which the zooming operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.SetZoom(System.Single,Carto.Core.MapPos,System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the new absolute zoom value. The minimum zoom value is 0, which means absolutely zoomed out and the maximum zoom value is 24. The zoom value can be further constrained by the Options::setZoomRange method. Values exceeding these ranges will be clamped.
Zooming is done towards the specified target position, keeping it at the same location on the screen.
If durationSeconds > 0, the zooming operation will be animated over time. If the previous zooming animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The new absolute zoom value.
The zooming target position in the coordinate system of the base projection.
The duration in which the zooming operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.MoveToFitBounds(Carto.Core.MapBounds,Carto.Core.ScreenBounds,System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Animate the view parameters (focus position, tilt, rotation, zoom) so that the specified bounding box becomes fully visible. This method does not work before the screen size is set.
member.param: The bounding box on the map to be made visible in the base projection's coordinate system.
The screen bounding box where to fit the map bounding box.
If true, then closest integer zoom level will be used. If false, exact fractional zoom level will be used.
The duration in which the operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.MoveToFitBounds(Carto.Core.MapBounds,Carto.Core.ScreenBounds,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Animate the view parameters (focus position, tilt, rotation, zoom) so that the specified bounding box becomes fully visible. Also supports resetting the tilt and rotation angles over the course of the animation. This method does not work before the screen size is set.
member.param: The bounding box on the map to be made visible in the base projection's coordinate system.
The screen bounding box where to fit the map bounding box.
If true, then closest integer zoom level will be used. If false, exact fractional zoom level will be used.
If true, view will be untilted. If false, current tilt will be kept.
If true, rotation will be reset. If false, current rotation will be kept.
The duration in which the operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.ScreenToMap(Carto.Core.ScreenPos)
member.summary: Calculates the map position corresponding to a screen position, using the current view parameters.
member.param: The screen position.
member.returns: The calculated map position in base projection coordinate system.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.MapToScreen(Carto.Core.MapPos)
member.summary: Calculates the screen position corresponding to a map position, using the current view parameters.
member.param: The map position in base projection coordinate system.
member.returns: The calculated screen position.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.CancelAllTasks
member.summary: Cancels all qued tasks such as tile and vector data fetches. Tasks that have already started may continue until they finish. Tasks that are added after this method call are not affected.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.ClearPreloadingCaches
member.summary: Releases the memory occupied by the preloading area. Calling this method releases some memory if preloading is enabled, but means that the area right outside the visible area has to be fetched again.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapView.ClearAllCaches
member.summary: Releases memory occupied by all caches. Calling this means that everything has to be fetched again, including the visible area.

member.name: T:Carto.DataSources.AssetTileDataSource
member.summary: A tile data source where each map tile is a seperate image file bundled with the application. The requests are generated using a template scheme, where tags in the basePath string are replaced with actual values. The following tags are supported: zoom, x, y, xflipped, yflipped, quadkey.
For example, if basePath = "t{zoom}_{x}_{y}.png" and the requested tile has zoom == 2, x == 1 and y == 3, then the tile will be loaded from the following path: "t2_1_2.png".

member.name: M:Carto.DataSources.AssetTileDataSource.SwigCreatePolymorphicInstanceAssetTileDataSource(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a polymorphic instance of the given native object. This is used internally by the SDK.
member.param: The native pointer of the instance.
The ownership flag.
member.returns: The created instance.

member.summary: Constructs an AssetTileDataSource object.
member.param: The minimum zoom level supported by this data source.
The maximum zoom level supported by this data source.
The base path containing tags (for example, "t{zoom}_{x}_{y}.png").

member.summary: Returns the actual class name of this object. This is used internally by the SDK.

member.name: T:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView
member.summary: A platform independent main view class for all mapping operations. Allows the user to manipulate the map and access various related components.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.RegisterLicense(System.String,Carto.Components.LicenseManagerListener)
member.summary: Registers the SDK license. This class method and must be called before creating any actual MapView instances.
member.param: The license string provided for this application.
The listener that receives notifications when the license has been updated.
member.returns: True if license is valid, false if not.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.GetSDKVersion
member.summary: Returns the SDK version and build info. The result should be used only for reporting purposes.
member.returns: The SDK version and build info.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.OnSurfaceCreated
member.summary: Prepares renderers for drawing. Has to be called again if the graphics context was lost.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.OnSurfaceChanged(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the screen size of the map view. Calling this method before onSurfaceCreated is called results in undefined behaviour.
member.param: The new width of the map view.
The new height of the map view.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.OnDrawFrame
member.summary: Draws a single frame to the current graphics context. Calling this method before onSurfaceCreated and onSurfaceChanged are called results in undefined behaviour.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.OnSurfaceDestroyed
member.summary: Stops renderer. Rendering may resume only after onSurfaceCreated is called again.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.OnInputEvent(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Handles a user input event.
member.param: The event type. First pointer down = 0, second pointer down = 1, either pointer moved = 2, gesture canceled = 3, first pointer up = 4, second pointer up = 5.
The x coordinate of the first pointer. -1 if there are no coordinates.
The y coordinate of the first pointer. -1 if there are no coordinates.
The x coordinate of the second pointer. -1 if there are no coordinates.
The y coordinate of the second pointer. -1 if there are no coordinates.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.GetLayers
member.summary: Returns the Layers object, that can be used for adding and removing map layers.
member.returns: The Layer object.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.GetOptions
member.summary: Returns the Options object, that can be used for modifying various map options.
member.returns: the Option object.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.GetMapRenderer
member.summary: Returns the MapRenderer object, that can be used for controlling rendering options.
member.returns: the MapRenderer object.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.GetFocusPos
member.summary: Returns the position that the camera is currently looking at.
member.returns: The current focus position in the coordinate system of the base projection.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.GetRotation
member.summary: Returns the map rotation in degrees. 0 means looking north, 90 means west, -90 means east and 180 means south.
member.returns: The map rotation in degrees in range of (-180 .. 180].

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.GetTilt
member.summary: Returns the tilt angle in degrees. 0 means looking directly at the horizon, 90 means looking directly down.
member.returns: The tilt angle in degrees.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.GetZoom
member.summary: Returns the zoom level. The value returned is never negative, 0 means absolutely zoomed out and all other values describe some level of zoom.
member.returns: The zoom level.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.Pan(Carto.Core.MapVec,System.Single)
member.summary: Pans the view relative to the current focus position. The deltaPos vector is expected to be in the coordinate system of the base projection. The new calculated focus position will be clamped to the world bounds and to the bounds set by Options::setPanBounds.
If durationSeconds > 0 the panning operation will be animated over time. If the previous panning animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The relative coordinate shift.
The duration in which the panning operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.SetFocusPos(Carto.Core.MapPos,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the new absolute focus position. The new focus position is expected to be in the coordinate system of the base projection. The new focus position will be clamped to the world bounds and to the bounds set by Options::setPanBounds.
If durationSeconds > 0 the panning operation will be animated over time. If the previous panning animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The new absolute focus position.
The duration in which the panning operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.Rotate(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Rotates the view relative to the current rotation value. Positive values rotate clockwise, negative values counterclockwise. The new calculated rotation value will be wrapped to the range of (-180 .. 180]. Rotations are ignored if Options::setRotatable is set to false.
If durationSeconds > 0 the rotating operation will be animated over time. If the previous rotating animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The delta rotation value in degrees.
The duration in which the rotation operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.Rotate(System.Single,Carto.Core.MapPos,System.Single)
member.summary: Rotates the view relative to the current rotation value. Positive values rotate clockwise, negative values counterclockwise. The new calculated rotation value will be wrapped to the range of (-180 .. 180]. Rotations are ignored if Options::setRotatable is set to false.
Rotating is done around the specified target position, keeping it at the same location on the screen.
If durationSeconds > 0 the rotating operation will be animated over time. If the previous rotating animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The delta angle value in degrees.
The zooming target position in the coordinate system of the base projection.
The duration in which the rotation operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.SetRotation(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the new absolute rotation value. 0 means look north, 90 means west, -90 means east and 180 means south. The rotation value will be wrapped to the range of (-180 .. 180]. Rotations are ignored if Options::setRotatable is set to false.
If durationSeconds > 0 the rotating operation will be animated over time. If the previous rotating animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The new absolute angle value in degrees.
The duration in which the rotation operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.SetRotation(System.Single,Carto.Core.MapPos,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the new absolute rotation value. 0 means look north, 90 means west, -90 means east and 180 means south. The rotation value will be wrapped to the range of (-180 .. 180]. Rotations are ignored if Options::setRotatable is set to false.
Rotating is done around the specified target position, keeping it at the same location on the screen.
If durationSeconds > 0 the rotating operation will be animated over time. If the previous rotating animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The new absolute angle value in degrees.
The zooming target position in the coordinate system of the base projection.
The duration in which the rotation operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.Tilt(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Tilts the view relative to the current tilt value. Positive values tilt the view down towards the map, negative values tilt the view up towards the horizon. The new calculated tilt value will be clamped to the range of [30 .. 90] and to the range set by Options::setZoomRange.
If durationSeconds > 0 the tilting operation will be animated over time. If the previous tilting animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The number of degrees the camera should be tilted by.
The duration in which the tilting operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.SetTilt(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the new absolute tilt value. 0 means look directly at the horizon, 90 means look directly down. The minimum tilt angle is 30 degrees and the maximum is 90 degrees. The tilt value can be further constrained by the Options::setTiltRange method. Values exceeding these ranges will be clamped.
If durationSeconds > 0 the tilting operation will be animated over time. If the previous tilting animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The new absolute tilt value in degrees.
The duration in which the tilting operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.Zoom(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Zooms the view relative to the current zoom value. Positive values zoom in, negative values zoom out. The new calculated zoom value will be clamped to the range of [0 .. 24] and to the range set by Options::setZoomRange.
If durationSeconds > 0 the zooming operation will be animated over time. If the previous zooming animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The delta zoom value.
The duration in which the zooming operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.Zoom(System.Single,Carto.Core.MapPos,System.Single)
member.summary: Zooms the view relative to the current zoom value. Positive values zoom in, negative values zoom out. The new calculated zoom value will be clamped to the range of [0 .. 24] and to the range set by Options::setZoomRange.
Zooming is done towards the specified target position, keeping it at the same location on the screen.
If durationSeconds > 0 the zooming operation will be animated over time. If the previous zooming animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The delta zoom value.
The zooming target position in the coordinate system of the base projection.
The duration in which the zooming operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.SetZoom(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the new absolute zoom value. The minimum zoom value is 0, which means absolutely zoomed out and the maximum zoom value is 24. The zoom value can be further constrained by the Options::setZoomRange method. Values exceeding these ranges will be clamped.
If durationSeconds > 0 the zooming operation will be animated over time. If the previous zooming animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The new absolute zoom value.
The duration in which the zooming operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.SetZoom(System.Single,Carto.Core.MapPos,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the new absolute zoom value. The minimum zoom value is 0, which means absolutely zoomed out and the maximum zoom value is 24. The zoom value can be further constrained by the Options::setZoomRange method. Values exceeding these ranges will be clamped.
Zooming is done towards the specified target position, keeping it at the same location on the screen.
If durationSeconds > 0, the zooming operation will be animated over time. If the previous zooming animation has not finished by the time this method is called, it will be stopped.
member.param: The new absolute zoom value.
The zooming target position in the coordinate system of the base projection.
The duration in which the zooming operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.MoveToFitBounds(Carto.Core.MapBounds,Carto.Core.ScreenBounds,System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Animate the view parameters (focus position, tilt, rotation, zoom) so that the specified bounding box becomes fully visible. This method does not work before the screen size is set.
member.param: The bounding box on the map to be made visible in the base projection's coordinate system.
The screen bounding box where to fit the map bounding box.
If true, then closest integer zoom level will be used. If false, exact fractional zoom level will be used.
The duration in which the operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.MoveToFitBounds(Carto.Core.MapBounds,Carto.Core.ScreenBounds,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Animate the view parameters (focus position, tilt, rotation, zoom) so that the specified bounding box becomes fully visible. Also supports resetting the tilt and rotation angles over the course of the animation. This method does not work before the screen size is set.
member.param: The bounding box on the map to be made visible in the base projection's coordinate system.
The screen bounding box where to fit the map bounding box.
If true, then closest integer zoom level will be used. If false, exact fractional zoom level will be used.
If true, view will be untilted. If false, current tilt will be kept.
If true, rotation will be reset. If false, current rotation will be kept.
The duration in which the operation will be completed in seconds.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.MapToScreen(Carto.Core.MapPos)
member.summary: Calculates the screen position corresponding to a map position, using the current view parameters.
member.param: The map position in base projection coordinate system.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.CancelAllTasks
member.summary: Cancels all qued tasks such as tile and vector data fetches. Tasks that have already started may continue until they finish. Tasks that are added after this method call are not affected.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.ClearPreloadingCaches
member.summary: Releases the memory occupied by the preloading area. Calling this method releases some memory if preloading is enabled, but means that the area right outside the visible area has to be fetched again.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.BaseMapView.ClearAllCaches
member.summary: Releases memory occupied by all caches. Calling this means that everything has to be fetched again, including the visible area.

member.name: M:Carto.VectorElements.Billboard.getRootGeometryInternal

member.name: T:Carto.Styles.BillboardOrientation
member.summary: Possible orientation modes for billboards.

member.name: F:Carto.Styles.BillboardOrientation.BillboardOrientationFaceCamera
member.summary: Billboard always faces the camera plane, regardless of rotation.

member.name: F:Carto.Styles.BillboardOrientation.BillboardOrientationFaceCameraGround
member.summary: Billboard lies parallel to the ground and rotates around it's anchor point to face the camera. SetRotation can be used to offset the final angle of the billboard.

member.name: F:Carto.Styles.BillboardOrientation.BillboardOrientationGround
member.summary: Billboard lies on the ground, orientation does not depend on the camera position.

member.name: T:Carto.Styles.BillboardScaling
member.summary: Possible scaling modes for billboards.

member.name: F:Carto.Styles.BillboardScaling.BillboardScalingWorldSize
member.summary: Billboard has a constant world space size. Zooming causes the billboard to get smaller or bigger on the screen.

member.name: F:Carto.Styles.BillboardScaling.BillboardScalingScreenSize
member.summary: Billboard's size on screen is unaffected by zooming, but billboards that are further away from the camera get smaller when the tilt angle is < 90.

member.name: F:Carto.Styles.BillboardScaling.BillboardScalingConstScreenSize
member.summary: Billboard's screen size is always the same, regardless of the zoom level, tilt angle or billboard's position.

member.name: T:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap
member.summary: A class that provides the functionality to store, compress, uncompress and resize basic image formats. Currently supported formats are png and jpeg. Upon loading compressed images will be converted to alpha premultiplied uncompressed bitmaps of various image formats.

member.name: M:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if this object is equal to the specified object.
member.param: The reference object.
member.returns: True when objects are equal, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash value of this object.
member.returns: The hash value of this object.

member.name: M:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap.#ctor(Carto.Core.BinaryData,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Carto.Graphics.ColorFormat,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a bitmap from an already decoded vector of bytes. The bitmap data is expected to be alpha premultiplied, if alpha channel is used. If the power of two conversion flag is set, additional padding will be added to the image to make it's dimensions power of two. This can be useful when creating OpenGL textures from the Bitmap, because some GPUs perform badly with non power of two textures.
member.param: A vector of decoded, premultiplied bitmap bytes.
The width of the bitmap.
The height of the bitmap.
The color format of the bitmap.

The total number of bytes per row. Some bitmaps have additional padding at the end of each row. If the value is negative, then bitmap is assumed to be vertically flipped. In this case absolute value of the bytesPerRow value is used.

member.name: M:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap.getPixelData
member.summary: Returns a copy of the pixel data of this bitmap.
member.returns: A binary data of the bitmap's pixel data.

member.name: M:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap.CompressToPng
member.summary: Compresses this bitmap to a png.
member.returns: A byte vector of the png's data.

member.name: M:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap.CompressToInternal
member.summary: Compresses this bitmap to a internal format. This operation is intended for serialization of the data only, no actual compression is performed.
member.returns: A byte vector of the serialized data.

member.name: M:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap.GetResizedBitmap(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns resized version of the bitmap. The power of two padding added during the construction of this bitmap will be removed prior to resizing. If the power of two conversion flag is set, new padding will be added to the image after resizing to make it's dimensions power of two.
member.param: The new width of this bitmap.
The new height of this bitmap.
member.returns: The resized bitmap instance or null in case of error (wrong dimensions).

member.name: M:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap.GetSubBitmap(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns sub-bitmap with specified offsets and dimensions.
member.param: X coordinate offset in the bitmap.
Y coordinate offset in the bitmap.
Width of the sub-bitmap.
Height of the sub-bitmap.
member.returns: Sub-bitmap instance or null in case of error (wrong dimensions).

member.name: M:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap.GetPaddedBitmap(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns paddedsub-bitmap with specified offsets and dimensions.
member.param: Padding along X coordinate. If negative value is used, the bitmap is padded from the left. By default, bitmap is padded from the right.
Padding along Y coordinate. If negative value is used, the bitmap is padded from the top. By default, bitmap is padded from the bottom.
member.returns: Padded bitmap instance or null in case of error (wrong dimensions).

member.name: M:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap.GetRGBABitmap
member.summary: Returns copy of the bitmap converted to RGBA format.
member.returns: The bitmap with identical dimensions but converted to RGBA format.

member.name: M:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap.CreateFromCompressed(Carto.Core.BinaryData)
member.summary: Creates a new bitmap from compressed byte vector. If the power of two conversion flag is set, additional padding will be added to the image to make it's dimensions power of two.
member.param: The compressed bitmap data.
member.returns: The bitmap created from the compressed data. If the decompression fails, null is returned.

member.name: P:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap.Width
member.summary: Returns the width of the bitmap.

member.name: P:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap.Height
member.summary: Returns the height of the bitmap.

member.name: P:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap.ColorFormat
member.summary: Returns the color format of this bitmap.

member.name: P:Carto.Graphics.Bitmap.BytesPerPixel
member.summary: Returns the bytes per pixel parameter of this bitmap. Valid values are 1, 2, 3 and 4.

member.name: T:Carto.DataSources.BitmapOverlayRasterTileDataSource
member.summary: Tile data source that uses given bitmap with two, three or four control points define a raster overlay. Note: if two points are given, conformal transformation is calculated. If three points are given, affine transformation is calculated. In case of four points, perspective transformation is used.

member.name: M:Carto.DataSources.BitmapOverlayRasterTileDataSource.SwigCreatePolymorphicInstanceBitmapOverlayRasterTileDataSource(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a polymorphic instance of the given native object. This is used internally by the SDK.
member.param: The native pointer of the instance.
The ownership flag.
member.returns: The created instance.

member.name: M:Carto.DataSources.BitmapOverlayRasterTileDataSource.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,Carto.Graphics.Bitmap,Carto.Projections.Projection,Carto.Core.MapPosVector,Carto.Core.ScreenPosVector)
member.summary: Constructs a new bitmap overlay data source.
member.param: The minimum zoom for generated tiles.
The maximum zoom for generated tiles.
The bitmap to use as an overlay.
The projection definining coordinate system of the control points.
The geographical control points. The list must contain either 2, 3 or 4 points.
The pixel coordinates in the bitmap corresponding to geographical control points. The number of coordinates must be equal to the number of control points in mapPoses list.
member.exception: If the transformation can not be calculated.

member.summary: An image format that describes images with three channels, one for each color: red, green and blue.

member.name: F:Carto.Graphics.ColorFormat.ColorFormatRgba
member.summary: An image format that describes images with four channels, one for each color: red, green and blue and one for alpha.

member.summary: An image format that describes images with four channels, one for each color: blue, green and red and one for alpha. This color format will be converted to RGBA.

member.name: F:Carto.Graphics.ColorFormat.ColorFormatRgba4444
member.summary: An image format that describes images with four channels, one for each color: red, green, and blue and one for alpha. Each color is only four bits. This color format will be converted to RGBA.

member.name: F:Carto.Graphics.ColorFormat.ColorFormatRgb565
member.summary: An image format that describes images with three channels, one for each color: red, green, and blue. Red and blue colors are each packed into 5 bits, green into 6 bits. This color format will be converted to RGB.

member.name: T:Carto.Geometry.DouglasPeuckerGeometrySimplifier
member.summary: An implementation of Ramer-Douglas-Peucker algorithm for geometry simplification. Simplifier works on lines and polygons. Simplification is done in two passes - first pass uses fast Radial Distance vertex rejection, second pass uses Ramer-Douglas-Peuckerworst algorithm (with worst case quadratic complexity).

member.name: T:Carto.DataSources.HTTPTileDataSource
member.summary: A tile data source that loads tiles using a HTTP connection. The requests are generated using a template scheme, where tags in the baseURL string are replaced with actual values. The following tags are supported: s, z, zoom, x, y, xflipped, yflipped, quadkey, frame.

For example, if baseURL = "http://tile.openstreetmap.org/{zoom}/{x}/{y}.png" and the requested tile has zoom = 2, x = 1 and y = 3, then the tile will be loaded from the following URL: "http://tile.openstreetmap.org/2/1/3.png".

member.param: The native pointer of the instance.
The ownership flag.
member.returns: The created instance.

member.summary: Constructs a HTTPTileDataSource object.
member.param: The minimum zoom level supported by this data source.
The maximum zoom level supported by this data source.
The base URL containing tags (for example, "http://tile.openstreetmap.org/{zoom}/{x}/{y}.png").

member.summary: Returns the actual class name of this object. This is used internally by the SDK.

member.name: T:Carto.Components.Layers
member.summary: Container for all raster and vector layers of the map view.

The order in which layers are added is important for vector elements like Points, Lines and Polygons. For these elements the layer ordering defines their draw order. Other elements like NMLModels and Polygon3Ds are z ordered and are drawn using the depth buffer. For Billboard elements like Markers and Labels, the layer ordering is unimportant, because they will be sorted from back to front and drawn in that order on top of all other vector elements.

member.name: T:Carto.Styles.LineJoinType
member.summary: Possible styles in which line segments are connected with each other.

member.name: F:Carto.Styles.LineJoinType.LineJoinTypeNone
member.summary: Line segments are not connected with each other. The fastest and ugliest.

member.name: F:Carto.Styles.LineJoinType.LineJoinTypeMiter
member.summary: Line segments are connected with each other using miter connections. This is the preferred mode (fast and good looking generally).

member.name: F:Carto.Styles.LineJoinType.LineJoinTypeBevel
member.summary: Line segments are connected with each other using bevel (straight line) connectors. Fast but results in an unnatural line.

member.name: F:Carto.Styles.LineJoinType.LineJoinTypeRound
member.summary: Line segments are connected with each other using circle sectors resulting in round corners. Slowest and prettiest.

member.name: T:Carto.DataSources.LocalVectorDataSource
member.summary: A modifiable vector data source that keeps all the elements in the local memory. Optionally vector elements can be kept in a spatial index and only the visible elements get rendered. There can be a small delay before previously invisible elements become visible after view changes. This makes it suitable for cases where there are a large number of static vector elements.
The draw order of vector elements within the data source is undefined.

member.name: T:Carto.Core.MapBounds

member.name: T:Carto.Ui.MapEventListener
member.summary: Listener for events like map clicks etc.

member.summary: Creates a polymorphic instance of the given native object. This is used internally by the SDK.

The ownership flag.
member.returns: The created instance.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapEventListener.OnMapIdle
member.summary: Listener method that gets called at the end of the rendering process when the map view needs no further refreshing. Note that there can still be background processes (tile loading) that may change the map view but these may take long time. This method is called from GL renderer thread, not from main thread.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapEventListener.OnMapMoved
member.summary: Listener method that gets called when the map is panned, rotated, tilted or zoomed. The thread this method is called from may vary.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapEventListener.OnMapStable
member.summary: Listener method that gets called when map is in 'stable' state - map animations have finished, user has lifted fingers from the screen. This method is similar to onMapIdle, but is called less frequently and takes account touch state. The thread this method is called from may vary.

member.name: M:Carto.Ui.MapEventListener.OnMapClicked(Carto.Ui.MapClickInfo)
member.summary: Listener method that gets called when a click is performed on an empty area of the map. This method will NOT be called from the main thread.
member.param: A container that provides information about the click.

member.summary: Returns the actual class name of this object. This is used internally by the SDK.
member.returns: The class name of this object.

member.summary: Returns the pointer to the connected director object. This is used internally by the SDK.
member.returns: The pointer to the connected director object or null if director is not connected.

member.name: T:Carto.Core.MapPos
member.summary: A double precision map position defined using three coordinates. X and y coordinates denote positions on the map, while z coordinate is height from the ground plane. Actual units for x, y and z depend on map projection. For example, in EPSG:4326 x is used for latitude, y for longitude and z for height in meters.

member.name: M:Carto.Renderers.MapRendererListener.OnBeforeDrawFrame
member.summary: Listener method that gets called at the start of the rendering process. The method can be used to synchronize vector elements with renderer state, for example to force marker to be always at the center of the screen (focus point). This method is called from GL renderer thread, not from main thread.

member.name: M:Carto.Components.Options.setBaseProjectionInternal(Carto.Projections.Projection)
member.summary: Sets the base projection. All MapView, MapEventListener and Options methods use the coordinate system of this projection. For example, if base projection is set to EPSG3857 then MapView::getFocusPos returns the coordinates in the EPSG3857 coordinate system, The same applies to setter methods like MapView::setFocusPos which expect the input coordinates to be in the base projection's coordinate system. The default is EPSG3857.
member.param: The new base projection.

member.name: M:Carto.PackageManager.PackageInfo.GetNames(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the names (short description) of the package. This can be displayed to the user. Each package may have multiple names, if the package has multiple classifications. Note: this information is dervied from package meta info, "name_XXX" fields.
member.param: The language for the name
member.returns: The list of names for the package in the specified language (if not available, generic/English names are returned)

member.name: P:Carto.PackageManager.PackageInfo.PackageId
member.summary: Returns the internal package id. This should not be displayed to the user.

member.name: P:Carto.PackageManager.PackageInfo.PackageType
member.summary: Returns the package type.

member.name: P:Carto.PackageManager.PackageInfo.Name
member.summary: Returns the default name (short description) of the package. It is better to use getNames method instead, as each package may contain multiple names. The name returned is generic name or if that is not available, then English name.

member.name: P:Carto.PackageManager.PackageInfo.Version
member.summary: Returns the package version. This should not be displayed to the user.

member.name: P:Carto.PackageManager.PackageInfo.Size
member.summary: Returns the size of the package in bytes. This can be displayed to the user.

member.name: P:Carto.PackageManager.PackageInfo.MetaInfo
member.summary: Returns package meta info. If package contains no meta info, null is returned.

member.name: P:Carto.PackageManager.PackageInfo.TileMask
member.summary: Returns the encoded tile mask of the package. This is available for map packages but not for routing packages. This should not be displayed to the user.

members.member: Note that the IEnumerator documentation requires an InvalidOperationException to be thrown whenever the collection is modified. This has been done for changes in the size of the collection but not when one of the elements of the collection is modified as it is a bit tricky to detect unmanaged code that modifies the collection under our feet.

member.name: T:Carto.PackageManager.PackageManager
member.summary: Base class for offline map package manager. Package manager supports downloading/removing packages. It can be queried about available packages and status of the packages. It works asynchronously in the background and can inform app when packages have been updated. It works persistently. If a package download is started and app is closed, the download will resume when the package manager is started next time.

The ownership flag.
member.returns: The created instance.

member.name: M:Carto.PackageManager.PackageManager.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new package manager, given URL for package list and data folder. The data folder must exist before creating a new package manager and it is assumed to be persistent. Note: the package manager must be explicitly started using start() method!
member.param: The URL that defines all packages.
The folder where downloaded packages are kept. It must exist and must be writable.
Encryption key for server packages
Encryption key for local packages
member.exception: If package manager fails to open or create package database.

member.summary: Starts the package manager. All previous tasks will be resumed after this.
member.returns: True if package manager was successfully started. False otherwise (can not create/access database).

member.name: M:Carto.PackageManager.PackageManager.Stop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stops the package manager. The stopping can be asynchronous or synchronous.
member.param: If set to true, then synchronous stopping is performed and the operation may take a while.

member.summary: Returns the status of the specified package.
member.param: The id of the package.
The version of the package. Use -1 for the latest version.
member.returns: The status of the package or null if it is not yet downloaded. If the package is currently being downloaded, its status is returned.

member.name: M:Carto.PackageManager.PackageManager.StartPackageListDownload
member.summary: Starts downloading package list asynchronously. When this task finishes, listener is called and server package list is updated.
member.returns: True if the package list will be downloaded and listener will be notified (if set). False if it can not be downloaded.

member.name: M:Carto.PackageManager.PackageManager.StartPackageImport(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Starts importing the specified package asynchronously. When this task finishes, listener is called and local package list is updated. Note 1: In general, package manager may need temporary storage equal to the size of the package during import. It is the responsibility of the app to perform such checks. Note 2: the package may not be deleted after this call, as the import is asynchronous operation. It is safe to delete the original file once import is complete (this is notified via manager listener).
member.param: The id of the package to download.
The version of the package.
The fully qualified path of the package.
member.returns: True is the package will be imported.

member.name: M:Carto.PackageManager.PackageManager.StartPackageDownload(System.String)
member.summary: Starts downloading specified package asynchronously. When this task finishes, listener is called and local package list is updated. Note: In general, package manager may need temporary storage equal to the size of the package during download. It is the responsibility of the app to perform such checks.
member.param: The id of the package to download.
member.returns: True is the package is available and will be downloaded. False if the package was not found.

member.name: M:Carto.PackageManager.PackageManager.StartPackageRemove(System.String)
member.summary: Starts the removal of specified package asynchronously. When this task finishes, listener is called and local package list is updated.
member.param: The id of the package to remove.
member.returns: True is the package was found and will be removed. False if the package was not found.

member.name: M:Carto.PackageManager.PackageManager.CancelPackageTasks(System.String)
member.summary: Cancels the current/pending tasks involving of the specified package.
member.param: The id of the package to cancel

member.name: M:Carto.PackageManager.PackageManager.SetPackagePriority(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the priority of the specific package. If the given priority is higher than priority of any other package, other operations will be paused and this package is processed immediately. If the given priority is set to negative value, package download will be paused until priority is reset to non-negative value.
member.param: The id of the download package.
The priority of the download package. If it is less than zero, package download is paused.

member.name: T:Carto.Components.PanningMode
member.summary: Possible panning modes for dual touch user input.

member.name: F:Carto.Components.PanningMode.PanningModeFree
member.summary: Free panning means that the map panning is unrestricted, user is able to zoom, rotate and pan the map at the same time without any artificial limits.

member.name: F:Carto.Components.PanningMode.PanningModeSticky
member.summary: Sticky panning means that the map panning is restricted, user is able to freely pan the map, but zooming and rotating gestures can't be performed at the same time. User is still able to switch between zooming and rotating the map but it takes a bit more effort compared to FREE panning. gesture is performed and

member.name: F:Carto.Components.PanningMode.PanningModeStickyFinal
member.summary: Final sticky panning means that the map panning is restricted, user is able to freely pan the map, but zooming and rotating gestures can't be performed at the same time. Once the gesture type is determined the user is stuck with either zooming or rotating. To switch the gesture the user has to lift at least one the two fingers off the screen.

member.name: T:Carto.DataSources.PersistentCacheTileDataSource
member.summary: A tile data source that loads tiles from another tile data source and caches them in an offline sqlite database. Tiles will remain in the database even after the application is closed. The database contains table "persistent_cache" with the following fields: "tileId" (tile id), "compressed" (compressed tile image), "time" (the time the tile was cached in milliseconds from epoch). Default cache capacity is 50MB.

member.name: M:Carto.DataSources.PersistentCacheTileDataSource.SwigCreatePolymorphicInstancePersistentCacheTileDataSource(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a polymorphic instance of the given native object. This is used internally by the SDK.
member.param: The native pointer of the instance.
The ownership flag.
member.returns: The created instance.

member.summary: Constructs a PersistentCacheTileDataSource object from tile data source and a sqlite database. The sqlite database must be writable, if it doesn't exist, an empty one will be created instead.
member.param: The datasource to be cached.
The path to the sqlite database, where the tiles will be cached.

member.name: M:Carto.DataSources.PersistentCacheTileDataSource.Close
member.summary: Close the cache database. The datasource will still work afterwards, but all requests will be directed to the original datasource.

members.member: Note that the IEnumerator documentation requires an InvalidOperationException to be thrown whenever the collection is modified. This has been done for changes in the size of the collection but not when one of the elements of the collection is modified as it is a bit tricky to detect unmanaged code that modifies the collection under our feet.

member.name: T:Carto.Components.ProjectionMode
member.summary: Possible projection modes.

member.name: F:Carto.Components.ProjectionMode.ProjectionModeOrthogonal
member.summary: Orthogonal projection mode means that the size of the objects on the screen does not depend on their distance from the camera. This might be useful because it avoids perspective distortion, but it becomes unusable at small tilt angles. This is sometimes confused with isometric projection which is a subtype of orthogonal projection.

member.name: F:Carto.Components.ProjectionMode.ProjectionModePerspective
member.summary: Perspective projection means that the further away objects get from the camera the smaller they appear on the screen. This projection mode is used in most 3D games and applications.

member.name: M:Carto.DataSources.TileDataSource.NotifyTilesChanged(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Notifies listeners that the tiles have changed. Action taken depends on the implementation of the listeners, but generally all cached tiles will be reloaded. If the removeTiles flag is set all caches will be cleared prior to reloading, if it's not set then the reloaded tiles will replace the old tiles in caches as they finish loading.
member.param: The remove tiles flag.

members.member: Note that the IEnumerator documentation requires an InvalidOperationException to be thrown whenever the collection is modified. This has been done for changes in the size of the collection but not when one of the elements of the collection is modified as it is a bit tricky to detect unmanaged code that modifies the collection under our feet.

member.name: T:Carto.Layers.VectorElementEventListener
member.summary: Listener for vector element events like clicks etc.

member.name: M:Carto.Layers.VectorElementEventListener.SwigCreatePolymorphicInstanceVectorElementEventListener(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a polymorphic instance of the given native object. This is used internally by the SDK.
member.param: The native pointer of the instance.
The ownership flag.
member.returns: The created instance.

member.name: M:Carto.Layers.VectorElementEventListener.OnVectorElementClicked(Carto.Ui.VectorElementClickInfo)
member.summary: Listener method that gets called when a click is performed on a vector element. If there are multiple vector elements that are located at the click position, then the results will be sorted by their distance to the camera. The closest element will be called first. If the method returns true, all subsequent elements are ignored. Otherwise the method is called on the next element and so on. This method will NOT be called from the main thread.
member.param: A container that provides information about the click.
member.returns: True if the click is handled and subsequent elements should not be handled. False if the next element should be called.

member.name: M:Carto.Layers.VectorElementEventListener.SwigGetClassNameVectorElementEventListener
member.summary: Returns the actual class name of this object. This is used internally by the SDK.
member.returns: The class name of this object.

member.name: M:Carto.Layers.VectorElementEventListener.SwigGetDirectorObjectVectorElementEventListener
member.summary: Returns the pointer to the connected director object. This is used internally by the SDK.
member.returns: The pointer to the connected director object or null if director is not connected.

members.member: Note that the IEnumerator documentation requires an InvalidOperationException to be thrown whenever the collection is modified. This has been done for changes in the size of the collection but not when one of the elements of the collection is modified as it is a bit tricky to detect unmanaged code that modifies the collection under our feet.

member.summary: Returns the conversion ratio between internal map units and screen density independent pixels (DP or DIP). This parameter is dependent on the zoom level, DPI and other screen parameters.

member.name: P:Carto.Graphics.ViewState.UnitToPXCoef
member.summary: Returns the conversion ratio between internal map units and screen pixels. This parameter is dependent on the zoom level and other screen parameters.

member.summary: Returns the aspect ratio of the map screen. Equal to width / height.
